translation.en: I've flown with the Great Condor!
-I can't believe it! -He's gonna ruin everything!
-I have a feather from the Great Condor! -Stop it! You're frightening them!
translation.ko: 그레이트 콘도르의 깃털이야! 뛰지 마, 라마가 겁먹잖아!

translation.en: You can be such a pain.
-Go play somewhere else. -I've flown with the Great Condor!
translation.ko: 다른 데 가서 놀아! 그레이트 콘도르랑 날았어요!

translation.en: Only the mountain wind may enter my house without being invited.
translation.ko: 산바람만이 내 초대 없이 이 집에 들어올 수 있다

translation.en: But, Shaman... I flew with the Great Condor! Look!
translation.ko: 샤먼님 저 그레이트 콘도르와 날았어요! 이것 보세요!

translation.en: You flew with the Great Condor?
Am I a shaman now, Shaman?
Do you believe a feather is enough to make a shaman out of you?
translation.ko: 깃털 하나로 샤먼이 될 수 있을 것 같으냐?

translation.en: Your time would be better spent thinking
about what you plan to offer to Pachamama tomorrow.
You know your offering must be your most precious treasure.
translation.ko: 네게 가장 소중한 보물을 제물로 바쳐야 해
감자 흙 터는 거 너무 싫어

translation.en: Now, this is a very good question.
Let us see if Naïra here can answer it for us,
since she will soon become a Great One.
First they appear as little, tiny seeds.
Pachamama buries them in her belly.
She nourishes and protects them until the harvest season.
translation.ko: 수확 철이 올 때까지 양분을 주고 지켜주셔

translation.en: Just like a mother does with her baby.
We are all children of Pachamama.
That is why we must love her as much as she loves us.
Tell us how we shall show our gratitude
to Pachamama for this abundant crop.
I'll make my first offering, and so will Naïra.
translation.ko: 저랑 나이라는 첫 제물을 바치게 될 거죠

translation.en: And bang, after that, we become Great Ones, and that's it.
translation.ko: 그리고 짠! 우리는 그레이트 원이 되는 거예요

translation.en: -I'm dreaming. -You're not sleeping, but you're dreaming?
translation.ko: 꿈꾸고 있어 안 자는데 꿈을 꾼다고?

translation.en: -That way, I can have any dream I want. -And what are you dreaming about?
translation.ko: 그래야 내가 원하는 꿈을 꾸지 무슨 꿈 꾸는데?

translation.en: Mama Quilla is now high in the sky.
What are you gonna ask from Pachamama tomorrow?
translation.ko: 내일 파차마마께 어떤 소원 빌 거야?

translation.en: You didn't get it, did you?
You know everything, don't you, Miss Perfect?
translation.ko: 모르는 게 없어서 좋겠다 척척박사 씨

translation.en: The snakes are the keepers of our cave.
They can recognize who is ready to appear before our ancestors.
translation.ko: 조상님을 마주할 준비가 된 사람을 알아보지

translation.en: Beloved ancestors, I come to disturb your peaceful rest
translation.ko: 친애하는 조상님들 평화로운 휴식을 방해해서 죄송합니다

translation.en: only to ask you to entrust me with the huaca.
Thank you, ancestors, for your kindness.
I will return it after the ceremony.
Thank you, Mama Quilla, for illuminating our cave.
Your children are all gathered here
to honor and thank you for this harvest.
Our ancestors shaped her and placed within her

translation.ko: 그 안에 가장 귀한 보물을 넣어두셨죠

translation.en: we return to you all that which you have given to us.
May these offerings feed your belly.
translation.ko: 이 제물들이 파차마마의 배를 채울 수 있기를

translation.en: Naïra and Tepulpaï have grown strong and healthy thanks to you.
translation.ko: 파차마마 덕분에 나이라와 테풀파이는 건강하게 성장했습니다

translation.en: The time has come for them to make their first offering
as a token of gratitude to you.
you must offer to Pachamama the most precious thing you have.
translation.ko: 파차마마께는 가장 귀중한 걸 바쳐야 한다

translation.en: But this is all I have.
I have a feeling you can do better.
translation.ko: 그보다 더 귀중한 게 있을 텐데

translation.en: It'll have to wait until the next harvest.
Tepulpaï is not a Great One yet!
She's the most precious thing I have.
Must the blood of this llama be shed?
that she is shedding her own tears upon our village.
Sorry. I took you for a stone.
We barely finished picking our crops.
It's the Great Collector of the Great Inca.
May our sun god, Inti, illuminate all of you,
and woe to the thief, the liar...
I come to collect that which is due to his son, the Great Inca.
translation.ko: 그레이트 잉카 덕에 얻은 수확물을 징수하러 왔다

translation.en: and we had an abundant harvest.
What? You have thrown all that away?
-What a waste! -We did not throw it away.
translation.ko: 이런 낭비를 봤나! 버린 게 아닙니다

translation.en: Whatever we give to Pachamama comes back to us.
Here is the portion we have set aside for you.
Who are you to decide what is due to the Great Inca?
translation.ko: 그레이트 잉카 덕에 얻은 걸 누구 맘대로 정해?

translation.en: You must give as many bags as there are knots in my quipu,
translation.ko: 내 키푸에 묶인 매듭 수 만큼의 자루를 바쳐야 하는데

translation.en: -No one can be worse than these Incas! -They're taking away all our crops.
translation.ko: 악덕 잉카 족 같으니 우리 곡식을 모조리 가져가잖아

translation.en: We'll have nothing left to eat.
translation.ko: 먹을 게 하나도 안 남을 거예요

translation.en: We're lucky they can't take our fields away.
but you chose to dump everything down into that hole.
You wretched peasants are too generous with your Pachamama.
translation.ko: 너희 가엾은 소작농들은 파차마마한테 너무 관대해

translation.en: They are offerings so that she might protect our village.
translation.ko: 그건 마을을 지켜주시는 대가로 드리는 제물입니다

translation.en: The only one who protects you is the Great Inca!
He builds the roads and illuminates the world!
This statuette makes you all stupid. I am confiscating it.
translation.ko: 이 조각상 때문에 멍청해졌군 - 압수하겠다 - 안 돼!

translation.en: I will offer it to the Great Inca as a sign of submission from your village.
translation.ko: 너희 마을의 복종의 징표로 그레이트 잉카께 드리겠다

translation.en: Let's go attack them by surprise and squish them!
Vengeance is not in the spirit of the Condor.
But we can't just sit around and do nothing! We have to get the huaca back!
translation.ko: 손 놓고 있을 순 없잖아요 우아카를 되찾아야 해요

translation.en: I will see to that. As soon as Walumama no longer needs my care.
But, Shaman, if we wait too long, we'll never catch them.
translation.ko: 하지만 너무 오래 기다리면 저들을 못 따라잡아요

translation.en: They'll get to Cusco and give the huaca to the Great Inca.
Can't you just listen to the shaman without arguing for a change?
translation.ko: 가끔은 샤먼님 말씀대로 따르면 안 돼?

translation.en: Listen to the shaman, will you?
You're back. So you're not mad at me, after all?
Come on. I'll show the shaman what I'm capable of.
translation.ko: 가자, 내 능력을 샤먼님께 보여드릴 거야

translation.en: Lucky you. You can eat whatever you find.
Make way for the chasqui, the messenger of the Inca!
Got any food or drink for me?
No way. I'm not carrying you. I'm tired.
translation.ko: 안 돼, 안 안아줄 거야 피곤하다고

translation.en: I'm coming with you, and so is Lamita.
The shaman sent you to spy on me, right?
He did not. He doesn't even know I'm here.
I see. So, now Miss Perfect is disobeying the shaman.
translation.ko: 그러셔? 척척박사 씨께서 샤먼님 말씀을 거역한다고?

translation.en: Someone must bring the huaca back to the village.
Kirkincho and I, we don't need any help.
See? You're such a coward, you can't even cross the bridge.
translation.ko: 거봐, 넌 너무 겁쟁이라 다리도 못 건너잖아

translation.en: -Go back to the village! -We're coming with you.
translation.ko: 마을로 돌아가! 너랑 같이 갈 거야

translation.en: You'll slow us down. I don't need you.
We didn't walk all this way for nothing.
translation.ko: 다시 돌아가려고 여기까지 온 거 아니야

translation.en: And don't tell me you don't need this.
for feeding us and giving us strength for this journey.
translation.ko: 일용할 양식과 여정을 떠날 힘을 주셔서요

translation.en: Right. We have no time for ceremony.
The Incas aren't gonna wait for us.
and I bring the huaca back to the village.
Talking is not gonna help us catch up with the Incas.
translation.ko: 말로 잉카 족을 따라잡을 순 없어

translation.en: Make way for the chasqui of the Inca!
Look at those stars above our village.
translation.ko: 우리 마을 위의 별들 좀 봐

translation.en: They're the stars of the Great Condor.
You know, I can't stop thinking about Walumama.
She was so ill when I left the village.
I'm sure the shaman will heal her.
And what if we don't find our huaca?
One of the stars is dancing.
Let's take advantage of the night to find the Incas.
translation.ko: 저녁엔 다들 잘 테니 거리를 좁히는 거야

translation.en: They've gone into the sea of clouds.
There's so many of them. They're stronger, and they've got weapons.
translation.ko: 인원이 너무 많아 우리보다 힘도 세고 무기도 가졌다고

translation.en: How are we gonna do this?
We'll just come from behind. Quiet and slow.
They won't see us with all these clouds.
The Incas are so loud. We can't miss them.
translation.ko: 잉카 족은 시끄러워서 소리를 따라가면 돼

translation.en: We must stick to the trail.
Thank you, Lamita. We're so lucky you're here.
translation.ko: 고마워, 라미타 네가 같이 와서 다행이야

translation.en: Walumama always says that whenever you're scared,
translation.ko: 왈루마마가 항상 말씀하시잖아 겁이 날 때마다

translation.en: you should breathe deeply to remind yourself that you're alive.
translation.ko: 심호흡을 해서 자신이 살아 있음을 떠올리라고

translation.en: I think I stepped on a...
Yes! I know how to find the Incas.
translation.ko: 그렇지! 잉카 족을 찾을 방법을 알았어

translation.en: I hate the Incas... and their llamas!
translation.ko: 잉카 족이랑 그자들 라마 진짜 싫어!

translation.en: They're going to meet with the great Inca.
We're not just going to jump into the mouth of the Puma.
translation.ko: 무작정 퓨마의 입으로 들어갈 순 없어

translation.en: I told you that it wouldn't be easy. No one forced you to come.
translation.ko: 내가 어려울 거라고 했지? 너한테 와달라고 한 적 없어

translation.en: May I remind you that, without us,
you would have fallen down and broken your neck in that sea of clouds.
translation.ko: 넌 구름바다 속에서 넘어져 목이 부러졌을 거야

translation.en: You should think twice before making decisions.
translation.ko: 뭔가를 결정하기 전에 두 번 생각해

translation.en: We are never gonna get our huaca back just by think twicing.
translation.ko: 두 번 생각하기로 우아카를 되찾을 순 없어

translation.en: Make way for the... chasqui of the Inca.
I've come from the shore with a message for the Great Inca.
translation.ko: 해안에서 오는 길이야 그레이트 잉카께 드릴 전갈을 가져왔어

translation.en: A floating house has arrived on the waters.
We must deliver the message to the Great Inca.
Isn't that what a chasqui's supposed to do?
I think he's gone to meet his ancestors.
Those gods are really... mighty gods.
So if the Great Inca needs to hear this message, right?
translation.ko: 그레이트 잉카께서 이 전갈을 들으셔야 하고

translation.en: And we need to get our huaca back... can't we make some kind of trade?
translation.ko: 우리는 우아카를 되찾아야 하니 거래하면 안 될까?

translation.en: Now, that, Naïra, that is some great think twicing.
translation.ko: 나이라, 그거야말로 두 번 생각하기의 좋은 예네

translation.en: He's come all that way to deliver this message.
translation.ko: 이 전갈을 전하려고 먼 길을 왔으니

translation.en: So now, it's up to us to finish his mission.
We won't let you down, brave chasqui. You'll be proud of us.
translation.ko: 용감한 차스키, 걱정 마세요 우리가 대신 전할게요

translation.en: They're not real pumas. They're just Inca guards.
Don't show them we're afraid, or else they won't let us through.
translation.ko: 겁먹은 거 들키지 마 들키면 안 들여보내 줄 테니

translation.en: May our god Inti illuminate you, travelers,
and may the thief, the liar, and the lazy man be punished.
translation.ko: 도둑과 거짓말쟁이 게으른 자에게 화가 미칠진저

translation.en: Fresh fish for the Great Inca!
They are on their way to see the Great Inca.
Wow! The Temple of the Sun.
That is a very high house.
It's high enough to be closer to his father, Inti.
all those stairs to get up there!
Besides, they say he never touches the ground.
translation.ko: 그레이트 잉카의 발은 절대 땅에 안 닿는대

translation.en: Make way for the chasquis of the Inca!
If you're a chasqui, then I'm a llama.
He claims to be a chasqui?
Any chasqui who blows into the pututu may enter the temple,
translation.ko: 푸투투를 부는 차스키는 신전에 출입할 수 있어

translation.en: Great Inca, here is some medicine prepared by our shaman
translation.ko: 그레이트 잉카 저희 샤먼이 제조한 약제입니다

translation.en: from the bark and roots of the Kuntisuyu, a plant found in our village.
translation.ko: 쿤티수유의 나무껍질과 뿌리로 만들었죠 저희 마을에서 나는 식물입니다

translation.en: Interesting. Give it to the llamas of the Inca.
Great Inca, our people, the Kollasuyo,
have crafted for you this cloak,
with the feathers of the rare luta bird from the White Mountains.
A rare bird that gets so easily caught has no glamour.
translation.ko: 쉽게 잡히는 희귀한 새는 매력이 없다

translation.en: This cloak is not a cloak,
He's being carried on some sort of tray by servants.
translation.ko: 하인들이 든 쟁반 같은 데 앉아 있네

translation.en: Great Inca, we have walked all the way from the riverbanks
to bring you this basket of fresh fish.
Not in the mood for fish.
we have run nine suns nonstop and--
Accept this offering from a remote village.
Its people wish to express their deep gratitude
and are now entirely devoted to Inti,

translation.ko: - 우리 우아카다! - 그레이트 잉카랑 말 좀 해야겠어

translation.en: -I'll have a word with this Great Inca. -No, wait. Let me handle it.
translation.ko: - 우리 우아카다! - 그레이트 잉카랑 말 좀 해야겠어 잠깐, 내가 해결할게

translation.en: Make way for the chasquis of the Inca!
These are some very tiny chasquis.
we bring you a very big...
As big as you, no doubt.
Just as soon as Your Lightness agrees to repair a great injustice.
translation.ko: 그레이트 잉카께서 엄청난 불의를 바로잡겠다고 약속하신다면요

translation.en: How dare you address the Son of the Sun with such arrogance?
translation.ko: 감히 태양의 아들 앞에서 그런 불손한 말을!

translation.en: Your great collector here stole this huaca.
You must give it back to us.
The peasants in that village are nothing but a lazy lot.
translation.ko: 그 마을의 소작농들은 게으르기 짝이 없습니다

translation.en: I already have a whole room filled with these trinkets,
bigger and fancier than this one.
Now, return this thing to the tiny chasqui.
Now, let me have my message.
Many metal gods have arrived on Mama Cocha, our mother sea.
translation.ko: 우리의 대해 마마 쿠차에 철의 신들이 찾아왔습니다

translation.en: spitting fire... and burying everything in their path.
translation.ko: 불을 내뿜고 보이는 건 모조리 묻으며

translation.en: And they will destroy the Incas.
The Great Inca is about to fall!
Woe to the world if he touches the ground.
I don't ever want to hear about those so-called metal gods again.
translation.ko: 철의 신들 얘기 다신 듣고 싶지 않다

translation.en: No one can destroy the son of Inti!
translation.ko: 누구도 인티의 아들을 무너뜨릴 수 없어!

translation.en: Throw these tiny liars into the dungeon.
translation.ko: 이 작은 거짓말쟁이들을 지하 감옥에 던져서

translation.en: The pumas will shut them up!
May the Great Condor strike you
and throw you out of your stupid tray!
The chasquis were telling the truth!
-They're monsters! -It's not funny. I want them to stop.
No! It contains our most sacred treasure!
translation.ko: 안 돼! 그 안에 가장 신성한 보물이 들었어!

translation.en: Don't worry, Naïra. She will find her way back to the village.
translation.ko: 걱정 마, 나이라 알아서 마을을 찾아올 거야

translation.en: Listen! That's condor feathers in there.
Here, run and bring the huaca back to the village.
You know, I'm glad to have you as a friend.
Now we've gotta get out of here and fast.
Naïra and Lamita need us. Do you smell something?
translation.ko: 나이라랑 라미타를 도와줘야지 무슨 냄새 맡았어?

translation.en: We don't want the pumas to catch us.
With you, it's always eat, eat, eat.
You're facing the power of the Great Condor!
This puma is the sun of my night.
And what is your name, little one?
I need to get out of this place as fast as possible
to go find my friend Naïra.
The men of metal are chasing her, and they want to steal--
translation.ko: 철을 두른 남자들이 나이라가 가진 걸 뺏으려고...

translation.en: They are the ones who make the ground tremble.
I saw them in the stars a long time ago.
Men of metal, with hair on their chins,
translation.ko: 철을 두르고 턱에 수염을 기른 사내들이

translation.en: And I know what they're capable of.
Oh, so you're the Great Observer.
Well, the Great Inca said you were a liar.
But he was wrong, it seems.
translation.ko: 근데 그레이트 잉카의 판단이 틀린 것 같구나

translation.en: The men of metal attacked him, and they took everything from him.
translation.ko: 그레이트 잉카도 공격당하고 가진 걸 전부 빼앗겼어요

translation.en: And, you know? He touched the ground! So now, you can get out, too.
translation.ko: 게다가 땅에 발이 닿았죠! 이제 여길 나가실 수 있어요

translation.en: Alas, there is no way out of the labyrinth.
I've been living alone here for so long.
Come, dry off in my chamber.
thank you for feeding me here in the depths of your belly.
translation.ko: 배 속의 일용할 양식을 주셔서 감사합니다

translation.en: You know, before they threw me into this hole,
I was the Great Observer of the Inca.
I worshiped Inti, our sun god.
I have become the Shadow Gazer.
Grateful for this puma to keep me company.
translation.ko: 퓨마가 내 친구가 돼줘서 참 다행이지

translation.en: You'll get used to it in time.
I don't wanna get used to it. I want to go home with Naïra,
translation.ko: 익숙해지기 싫어요 나이라, 라미타, 키르킨초와 우아카를 찾아서 집에 가고 싶어요
나이라, 라미타, 키르킨초와 우아카를 찾아서 집에 가고 싶어요

translation.en: Anger breathes crazy ideas through your head, my boy.
I hate the Incas and the men of metal. They're thieves.
translation.ko: 잉카 족과 철을 두른 사내들 싫어요 다 도둑이에요

translation.en: -They want to steal our huaca! -And have you never taken anything
translation.ko: 우리 우아카를 훔치려 한다고요! 넌 허락 없이 남의 것을 취한 적 없느냐?
넌 허락 없이 남의 것을 취한 적 없느냐?

translation.en: Forgive me, Great Condor, for taking that feather...
translation.ko: 깃털을 뽑은 절 용서하세요 그레이트 콘도르

translation.en: and for lying to the shaman.
I know how to get out!
no one can leave the realm of shadows.
translation.ko: 아무도 그림자 세계를 벗어날 수 없다

translation.en: The Great Condor is the master of the wind.
Thank you for leading me out of that labyrinth.
The Great Condor will fly us back to the village.
translation.ko: 그레이트 콘도르가 마을로 데려가 줄 거야

translation.en: No! This time, I'm not leaving Lamita!
translation.ko: 안 돼! 이번에는 라미타를 두고 가지 않겠어!

translation.en: It's up to you now, Kirkincho!
This is just like in my dream.
Look how beautiful Pachamama is from the sky.
The Great Condor is losing its feathers.
Do you think the Great Condor crashed?
I don't know, but we don't have much time. The men in metal will be here soon.
translation.ko: 모르겠어, 근데 시간이 얼마 없어 철을 두른 사내들이 곧 도착할 거야

translation.en: Here, take the huaca and protect her.
I'll run to the village to alert the shaman and Walumama.
translation.ko: 난 마을로 가서 샤먼님과 왈루마마께 경고할게

translation.en: Think twicing to you, too, Naïra!
I must protect the huaca, so...
Or hide her... in the cave!
I'm sorry for the bumpy landing.
Run to the cave, and bring the huaca back to the ancestors.
translation.ko: 동굴로 가서 우아카를 다시 조상님들께 바치거라

translation.en: All of you go hide behind the cacti, quick!
The men of metal are coming!
-Where's the shaman? -He left the village to find you.
The snakes are the keepers of our cave.
They can recognize who is ready to appear before our ancestors.
translation.ko: 조상님을 마주할 준비가 된 사람을 알아보지

translation.en: -You must trust them. -You must trust them.
You have no right to take what's inside of it!
translation.ko: 이 안의 것들은 가져갈 수 없어!

translation.en: Watch out! They will make the ground shake!
Ancestors, I have brought the huaca back to you.
I know. But the men of metal are here to attack our village.
translation.ko: 그런데 철을 두른 사내들이 우리 마을을 침략했어요

translation.en: Wow! You're not such a coward, after all! Let's go!
-Over here! Put it out! -Hurry, we need more!
translation.ko: - 이쪽에 부어 - 서둘러, 물이 더 필요해

translation.en: The fire! It's burning our fields!
Look! The shaman is calling for the rain!
translation.ko: 저기 봐요! 샤먼님께서 비를 부르고 있어요!

translation.en: Oh, no! Please, Shaman, don't give up!
The Inca stole all our crops.
translation.ko: 잉카 족이 우리 곡식을 훔쳐 갔어

translation.en: We have nothing left to eat.
And no more seeds to sow.
What are we going to do?
Why, Shaman? Why are such calamities striking our village?
translation.ko: 샤먼님, 왜 우리 마을에 이런 재앙이 닥친 거죠?
파차마마께서 더는 우리의 기도를 안 들으시는군

translation.en: I found these in the huaca.
These three seeds you stored in the huaca
are the last seeds we have left.
May this offering feed your belly.
translation.ko: 이 제물이 파차마마의 배를 채울 수 있기를

translation.en: Tepulpaï and Naïra, our two little saviors.
Tepulpaï, you have grown so much.
I see the Great Condor in you.
Now, dance for Pachamama, little Shaman.
translation.ko: 파차마마를 위해 춤을 추어라 꼬마 샤먼이여
